message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with distributed storage allocation and data access in a network, which falls under the scope of several arXiv CS sub-categories. cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely category as the paper deals with the problem of finding an optimal allocation that ensures recovery with probability one. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely categories as the paper proposes a fully distributed algorithm for storage allocation. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is another possible category as the paper deals with data access in a network. Finally, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is a possible category as the paper deals with the problem of finding a fractional dominating set in a network.
